newsitem.title: USA: Calif. Senate OKs bill to expand bond investments.
newsitem.headline: Calif. Senate OKs bill to expand bond investments.

text.p: California's Senate on Thursday approved a bill that would allow local agencies across the state to invest bond funds in a broader range of securities.
The state Senate voted 32-2 in favor of Senate Bill 1287 by Senator Charles Calderon. The measure now advances to the state Assembly.

The bill would apply to bonds issued under California's Mello-Roos Community Facilities Act of 1982. The act allows local agencies to finance a variety of local facilities and services through bonds supported by special taxes.
More than 125 Mello-Roos districts statewide have issued close to $3 billion worth of bonds since the 1982 act.

Senate Bill 1287 repeals the current restricted list of investments authorized for Mello-Roos proceeds, and allows the agencies to invest in a broader range of instruments and securities, including reverse repurchase agreements and medium-term corporate notes.
